text: <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> RANK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can activate the noncanonical NF-kappaB pathway that is dependent on <extra_id_0> NF-kappaB inducing kinase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) expression levels .

In unstimulated cells <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> forms a cytosolic complex with the ubiquitin ligases <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> cIAP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which facilitates the K48 - linked polyubiquitination and proteasomal degradation of <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , keeping <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels low .

Upon ligand binding , <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is recruited to the receptor , where <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> directs nondegradative K63 - linked polyubiquitination of <extra_id_0> cIAP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , resulting in their activation .

Subsequently <extra_id_0> cIAP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> directs its K48 - linked polyubiquitination to <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , rather than <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

As a result , <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is degraded and <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is stabilised , resulting in increased <extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> levels in the cell .

<extra_id_0> NIK <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> then phosphorylates and activates <extra_id_0> IKK1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which mediates NF-kappaB <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> phosphorylation .

This is followed by K48 - linked polyubiquitination and partial proteasomal degradation of <extra_id_0> p100 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to <extra_id_0> p52 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which forms a heterodimer with <extra_id_0> RelB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to activate transcription .

Next to <extra_id_0> TRAF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TRAF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has also been identified as a negative regulator of this pathway , most probably by competing with other TNF receptor - associated factors .
